scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John R. Couwenhoven papers span the period 1783 to 1812 and consist of a single bound account book and several loose handwritten documents. The account book lists monetary transactions for goods and services dated 1783 to 1789, and account for the sale of Couwenhoven's estate, including five enslaved African-Americans, during the period 1798 to 1812. The loose papers are dated 1797 to 1812 and record further transactions related to the sale of Couwenhoven's estate.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: John R. Couwenhoven was a resident of Brooklyn and a member of Brooklyn's prominent Couwenhoven family (alternate spellings include Cowenhoven and Kouwenhoven), whose common ancestor, Wolphert Gerritson Van Kouwenhoven, emigrated from the Netherlands to the town of New Utrecht in the Dutch colony of New Netherland (later New York) in the 17th century.
